page.title: 11Pontycymers Industrial scars
page.content: The Coal Field industry in Pontycymer has affected the physical landscape of the area. The unsightly pithead gear and colliery buildings cover 19.1 acres of the Pontycymmer area, though the Glengarw workings have been removed from the valley bottom by the N.C.B. The waste tips resulting from the colliery workings which lie around Pontycymer are probably the most unsightly as they do not blend with the natural landscape, cause loss of sunlight, create dust, and pollute the river Garw-"the black river". Other unfortunate consequences of the sub-surface workings are subsidence and landsliding. Pontycymer is liable to subsidence of up to four feet. Residents hope it will not take as long to remove the scars of industry as it took to create them.
